#FCA #ESG #sustainability #greenwashing FCA is consulting on new guidance (â€Anti-Greenwashingâ€œ) on their expectations for FCA-authorised firms making claims about the sustainability of a product or service. Consumers are increasingly demanding more sustainable products and services. As a result, there has been a growing number of products and services which claim to meet that demand. As this demand continues to grow, so does the risk of â€˜greenwashingâ€™ as there are concerns that some of these claims may be exaggerated and misleading. All sustainability-related claims made by FCA-authorised firms about their products and services must be fair, clear and not misleading, as FCA Â´ s anti-greenwashing rule sets out. This proposed guidance is designed to help firms better understand our expectations under the anti-greenwashing rule and other existing, associated requirements. Very interesting statements, looking forward to your comments. Best regards Hartmut Renz https://lnkd.in/db9nyHsH

The FCAâ€™s anti-greenwashing rule comes into force on May 31, 2024. This regulation, a pivotal component of the FCA's Sustainability Disclosure Requirements (SDR) regime, aims to bolster transparency in sustainable investment products and safeguard consumers from deceptive sustainability claims. Martin Lovick - Director of Capital Markets, provides insights into this regulatory measure, and looks at the applicability of the rule, extending to all FCA-regulated firms, whether or not they consciously provide or promote products or services with a sustainability or ESG theme. The article outlines the guidance from the FCA, offering examples that will fail to meet their expectations in the following areas: substantiating claims, ensuring clear communication, maintaining information completeness, and fairness in comparisons. Read the full article here https://lnkd.in/eUiXuyak #cosegic #compliance #capitalmarkets #fca #antigreenwashing #sustainability

Top three tips for #financialservices firms by BDO UK LLP on the FCA's #Sustainable #Disclosure Requirements and #labelling Regime (#sdr) and specifically, the #anti #greenwashing rules coming into effect 31 May 2024. 1. Assess if the firm is making any sustainability-related statements in relation to its products, services, or business strategy. 2. Assess if all communications and marketing materials, offering documents and regulatory disclosures are accurate and consistent with the sustainability characteristics of products and services. 3. Review whether there are appropriate governance and oversight controls over the sustainability communications that the firm makes. If you need support to understand the anti-greenwashing rule, the SDR regime more broadly, please get in touch.
